thread.title: Lindsay Lohan's New Show Is Mean Girls Meets Punk'd for the Social Media Age
thread.title_full: Lindsay Lohan's New Show Is Mean Girls Meets Punk'd for the Social Media Age

title: Lindsay Lohan's New Show Is Mean Girls Meets Punk'd for the Social Media Age
text:
Lindsay Lohan's New Show Is Mean Girls Meets Punk'd for the Social Media Age Most Popular By Alyssa Bailey Mar 22, 2017 Surprise: Lindsay Lohan is coming back to TV—or so it maybe seems in the U.K. A trailer for The Anti-Social Network was just released on Dose's Facebook page, where Lohan plays host and prankster to a bunch of U.K. 20somethings. Lohan will take over someone's social media, publicly humiliate them in a series of challenges (or at least, push their comfort zone), and give them prizes. As she puts it, "I love social media. I mean, I am social media," which is quite the claim. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Essentially, it's all very Regina George/Ashton Kutcher of her, with a cash reward to sweeten things in the end: Most Popular No release date (or even details on where it's airing) has been given yet, though Lohan posted the trailer on her own Twitter. So maybe this is an early April Fools' prank; maybe it's a strategy to build up suspense. Either way, well played, LiLo. ❤RT❤ if you are excited about my new show  pic.twitter.com/rNjR47Ngkd 
— Lindsay Lohan (@lindsaylohan) March 22, 2017 We'll update when more information becomes available. More from ELLE:
